page.title: 07HISTORY
page.content: The area consists of the village of Steeple Ashton and a small part of the village of Keevil. Steeple Ashton used to be a large town with a wool market;some ten thousand people lived there until most of the town was destroyed by fire in the sixteenth century.The market then moved away and, in spite of several attempts to revive it, never returned and Steeple Ashton became a small village with a large church that had been built by wealthy,local merchants just before the fire took place. Keevil is also an old village, both villages were largely farming communities but these days most of the people living there commute to nearby towns to work.Steeple Ashton is unusual in a village for the fact that it has a Magistrates Court which still functions.
